channel.title: Reyx's sketchbook
channel.description:
So for XMAS, I too (like a few other members on this forum) have gotten a tablet. I've only used a few times, but my Skyrim steam is slowly running out, so reality is fading back in. So I've pretty much decided to do some art on this thing. So far, from my experience, the range of colors is much nicer then my typical drawing ability, however it's rather strange drawing on plastic, and you often can't find your way. I work rather sketchy, so that's going to need to change. Over time, I plan to improve from this horrid first drawing. Anyway here you go, attempt one with the tablet. Hopefully one day I will reach the skill of Frell.
Pic 1 - 1/7. It's a wizard, and there's not much scenery. Still getting used to the tablet. That hand looks awful... only spent like 20 minutes on this. [IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/5o8qw9.jpg[/img]
Pic 2 - 1/8. Mountain view. More work with color, full filling of the screen. Colors are hard to blend together with tools, looks like I'll have to do natural gradation. Mountains look unfinished... oh well. [IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/16gejxf.jpg[/img]
Pic 3 - 1/9. Swamp. Again, color work. Trying to get smaller with my details, thus I shrunk the canvas. The tree looks better up close, oddly enough. Perspective is a little off, but still proved to be ok. [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/9aa539.jpg[/img]
Pic 4 - 1/10. Eye. Trying to take actual colors and implement them. Didn't turn out totally like an eye, but looks neat. [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/9led4w.jpg[/img]
Pic 5 - 1/30. Been awhile since I've done anything, here's some wizards duking it out. Completely different approach in brush strokes at before. [IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/2u58kxt.jpg[/img] And the other version, can't decide which is better. [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/2m4wzns.jpg[/img]
Pic 6 - 1/31. Ps3 controller, finally decided to work with layers. They treat you nicely, prevent from major mistakes occurring. [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/240zlar.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/9k5o4j.jpg[/img]
Pic 7 - 2/1. Cat in a window. I like the sketch version better, I'm having a hard time making sharp edges with my brush. [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/2untz5i.jpg[/img]

item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7

watch this then try again, youll have a 150% improvement asap[/quote]

Amazing. I’ll definitely take a completely different approach, thanks for sharing this.

item.title: Reyx's sketchbook
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Don't color it then. I never color any of my pencil drawings, I just shade with the right darkness of pencil with a special technique. They usually turn out great with no color. I would show you a picture I drew of a Beagle drawn in pencil with some good shading, but I cba to scan and upload it. in my opinion pencil shading (if done right) looks better than color.

I normally draw in pencil but when i want to change things around it doesn’t work out for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Reyx's sketchbook
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:54, topic:428519”]I might have to look into one, i love drawing on paper but i hate colouring. Very big problem isn’t it.[/quote]Don’t color it then. I never color any of my pencil drawings, I just shade with the right darkness of pencil with a special technique. They usually turn out great with no color. I would show you a picture I drew of a Beagle drawn in pencil with some good shading, but I cba to scan and upload it. in my opinion pencil shading (if done right) looks better than color.

@Rey: As someone already said, find an image on the interwebz and use it as a reference image, and start by drawing the outline, then do all the details. You’ll be amazed on how much you improve.

Read full topic

item.title: Reyx's sketchbook
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

amy_webb:

Does drawing on tablets make it easier then drawing on photoshop? I’ve been trying to draw a guys face on photoshop for like 3 days now on and off but i can’t seem to get it, i’m guessing it has something to do with the mouse hating me.

Most likely, unless you have a mouse with a dpi of 100, then they’re maybe about equal.

It depends hugely on the size of the tablet though, the bigger the better, and more accurate.

Read full topic

I say the doggy is red because he murder twenty kittens and rolled around in their blood. >.>

BUT before I go too off topic the doggy is very well drawn and Reyx’s drawings are unique (I’ve had a lot of fun drawing random things with tablets)

item.description:

reyx7:

The proportions on it are very nice… then again you’re a pro modeler (from my view).

Used a reference image References are always important in anything to do with graphics. Even if it’s your own hand-drawing.

item.title: Reyx's sketchbook
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

The nose and mouth are too small for the eyes, i suggest making them a tad bit bigger. Start off with the shape of your face then add in your features then from there add colour shading and all that.

Read full topic

item.title: Reyx's sketchbook
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Youre detailing too soon. Make rough shapes, dont care about detail and get those highlights and shadows quickly brushed in there. Believe me, thats all you need. Once you have those lights and shadows blocked in it will look like an eye already, just really bland, then you detail in. If you see a color somewhere, try and match the color (dont sample, bad habit) and just put there color where it belongs. Try and see the picture as just a big clump of colors and not for what it truly is and youll recreate it in no time.

Read full topic

item.title: Reyx's sketchbook

item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

I’ve got a shiny old acoustic guitar that I’m going to do tomorrow. Light reflects off it and it’s a variety of simple and complex shapes. I’m also going to completely avoid the ‘smudge’ tool.
